thread.title: Local roundup: Wheeler volleyball qualifies for postseason
thread.title_full: Local roundup: Wheeler volleyball qualifies for postseason

author: The Bulletin
title: Local roundup: Wheeler volleyball qualifies for postseason
text: NORTH STONINGTON — The Wheeler volleyball team outlasted Griswold, 3-2, on Wednesday to qualify for the Eastern Connecticut Conference and Class S state tournaments. The Lions won the deciding set, 15-8. Alysia Rathbun registered 37 digs and three aces for Wheeler (8-9, 2-5 ECC Small), while Lexi Gallucci (16 assists) and Zoe Robert (15 digs) each posted three kills. Cadey McCormack (eight aces) had a match-high 45 digs for Griswold, which won the fourth set, 25-12. Casey Rubino had 15 kills and 12 digs and Grace Peterson added 11 kills and 14 digs for the Wolverines (8-8, 4-3). Montville 3 New London 0 MONTVILLE — Olivia Fargo led the Indians with 12 digs and five aces and Montville earned the ECC Medium win, 25-16, 25-13, 25-11. Naomi Clark had six digs and three aces and Taylor Crews had a pair of kills for the Indians (8-9, 4-3). New London is 0-14, 0-8. East Lyme 3 Bacon 0 COLCHESTER — Madison Bell recorded 25 digs in the Vikings’ third win in a row. Alexis Bell added 24 assists for East Lyme (11-3, 6-2 ECC Large), which won 25-18, 25-23, 25-13. Elizabeth Kowalsky posted 15 digs and two kills for the Bobcats (4-15, 0-8) and Olivia McKenzie had seven kills. Ledyard 3 Killingly 1 Ledyard — Chloe Hespeler had 10 kills and two blocks to lead the Colonels to their third consecutive win, 26-24, 17-25, 26-24, 25-17. Jenna Boyd added six aces, six kills and two blocks for Ledyard (4-13, 4-3 ECC Medium). Ally Conde had nine kills and seven blocks and Karissa Slowik finished with 12 digs and eight kills for the Redgals (9-8, 3-4). Ethel Walker 3 Marianapolis 2 SIMSBURY — Freshman Olivia Summiel had six kills and four blocks in the Golden Knights’ 25-21, 19-25, 23-25, 25-23, 15-12 loss. Sophia Widmeyer had 18 kills, six blocks and three aces and Doreen Reagan dished out 18 assists for Marianapolis (7-5). Windham 3 Windham Tech 2 WILLIMANTIC — The Whippets rallied to win the final two sets, 25-17 and 15-7, to snap a four-game losing streak. Mio Gonzalez posted 18 assists and nine service points for Windham (4-13) and Tassi Gonzalez had 12 kills and three blocks. Ashley Torres recorded seven kills and nine service points for Windham Tech (11-6) and Makayla Christian added four kills, nine service points and 23 digs. Fitch 3 NFA 2 NORWICH — The Falcons came back after dropping the first two sets to win and finish the ECC Large Division schedule unbeaten, 15-25, 19-25, 25-17, 25-18, 15-13. Mae Sefransky had 42 assists and Jen Severino had a match-high 23 kills for Fitch (16-1, 8-0). Cebria Outlow had 13 kills and 12 blocks and Mackenzie Burke added 22 digs and 13 kills for the Wildcats (7-8, 2-5). Page 2 of 2 - Cheshire Academy 3 Pomfret 1 CHESHIRE — Cheshire won the final three games to pull away for the win, 20-25, 25-19, 15-12, 28-26, as the Griffins had their five-match win streak halted. Rita Calvert had 13 kills and Bristol Shields added 25 assists for the Griffins (9-4). FIELD HOCKEY Pomfret 5 Suffield Academy 1 POMFRET — Olivia Kremer scored three goals and the Griffins scored four times before halftime in the win. Taylor Ettore and Julia Gengras each scored for Pomfret (4-6). COLLEGES UConn 2 Temple 0 PHILADELPHIA — Freshman Abdou Mbacke Thiam scored a pair of second-half goals and the Huskies earned their fifth shutout victory, handing the Owls their first home loss. Scott Levene made two saves in goal for UConn (5-5-4). WOMEN’S SOCCER ECSU 3 Fitchburg State 0 MANSFIELD — Maggie Bodington scored the game’s first goal and assisted on the next two as the Warriors won their fourth straight. Former Woodstock standout Emily Becher scored twice and Kaley Kennedy made two saves in her first start of the season for ECSU (11-3-1). FROM TUESDAY H.S. XC Parish Hill’s Chesters wins CSC title MANCHESTER — Parish Hill’s Sabrina Chesters completed the 3.1-mile course in 20 minutes, 30 seconds to win her third consecutive CSC championship at Wickham Park. By The Bulletin
